es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4.command
Class ExamineCommand

java.lang.Object
  es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4.command.Command
      es.ucm.fdi.lps.p4.command.ExamineCommand
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class ExamineCommand
extends Command

Represents an Examine command from the player that that shows a list of the items in the player inventory or shows the description of an specific item, depending on the use mode.

  • It uses a command-specific property called "keyword.examineCommand" which default value is "examine".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "keyword.examineCommand.abbrev" which default value is "x".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "keyword.examineCommand.alt" which default value is "inventory".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.examineCommand.help" which default value is "(examine|x|inventory) [item name]".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.examineCommand.inventoryWithItems" which default value is "The inventory contains the following items: ".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.examineCommand.inventoryWithoutItems" which default value is "The inventory has no items.".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.examineCommand.itemNameNotInInventory" which default value is "There is no item with that name in the inventory.".
  • It uses a command-specific property called "message.examineCommand.itemNameRepeatedInInventory" which default value is "There are several items with that name in the inventory.".

Constructor Detail

ExamineCommand

public ExamineCommand(Game game)
Constructs an Examine command (as an specific type of Command) that has access to a given game. Initially the command is unparsed and unexecuted. Default configuration is assumed at this moment.

Parameters:
game - The game.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The argument 'game' cannot be null.

ExamineCommand

public ExamineCommand(Game game,
                      java.util.Properties config)
Constructs an Examine command (as an specific type of Command) that has access to a given game. Initially the command is unparsed and unexecuted. The properties defined in the given configuration override those of the default configuration.

Parameters:
game - The game.
config - The configuration.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The arguments 'game' and 'config' cannot be null.

execute

public boolean execute()
Executes the Examine command, obtaining as a result the list of all the items in the inventory (using the command without arguments) or the description of an specific item (using the command with the item name as argument).

Overrides:
execute in class Command
Returns:
true if the command has been correctly executed; false otherwise.
